Title: Test Lead
RoleDescription:
Do you want to lead the way in test automation at a global company shaping the future of the automotive industry? We are now looking for a Test Lead who wants to be at the technical forefront while building a strong, cohesive team. With us, you will have the opportunity to lead six experienced engineers and, together with them, develop the next generation of test infrastructure for future vehicles.In this role, you will combine strategic leadership with hands-on technical development. You will take a key role in shaping our test environments and ensuring that our tests meet the highest possible standards. Using Python as your primary tool, complemented by your knowledge of C and C++, you will both develop new frameworks and improve existing solutions. Your work will range from test automation to gaining a deeper understanding of embedded systems, making you a pivotal figure in our technical development. Experience with Bazel is a valuable plus, as we continuously strive to stay at the cutting edge of CI/CD and automated test flows. We would also welcome candidates with experience in Embedded systems, as this is highly relevant for the role. We operate in an industry where quality, safety, and precision are crucial. Thats why your understanding of automotive standards such as AUTOSAR, ASPICE, and ISO 26262 will be an important part of your work. You will be a central player in an international environment, working closely across functions and geographies to create systems that meet tomorrows demands on vehicle technology.As a leader, you are not just a coordinator  you are a role model and an inspirer. You coach your team, foster engagement, and drive development forward with a combination of technical expertise and a clear vision. Here, you will have the chance to influence both how we work today and how we build our methods for the future.As part of our recruitment process, we conduct education and background checks. Some assignments may also be security classified, in which case an approved security clearance is required before employment.We offer a unique opportunity to combine leadership and technology in a global company at the absolute forefront of innovation. If you want to take on a role where you can shape the future of test automation, work with some of the most advanced technologies in the industry, and be part of an international network of experts  then this is the role for you.We look forward to receiving your application. Title: Energy Market - Analyst - Madrid
RoleDescription:
We are currently recruiting for our Madrid team, but we have regular opportunities in our other offices Bogota, Bangkok, Beijing, Berlin, Dubai, Dusseldorf, Helsinki, London, Oxford, Milan, New York, Oslo, Paris, Stockholm, Vienna, and Zurich.
The challenges of decarbonisation, decentralisation and digitalisation require us to continually challenge our existing ideas to remain at the forefront of thinking on the future of the energy industry. All the work we do requires team working and you will be responsible for the delivery of the whole team. This involves planning the work, supporting the team, anticipating challenges, leading by example, and accountability towards the client (with more Senior support when required).Being fluent in Spanish and English. On the one hand our clients are located in Spanish and non-Spanish speaking countries, and on the other hand our work requires day-to-day collaboration  in English  with other AFRY offices.Writing and communication skills. Report-writing and presenting in public is a core part of our work, therefore we are also looking for the ability to explain complex information in a clear and logical way in English, both in writing and orally.Proactivity and responsibility. You have a holistic understanding of European electricity or gas market dynamics, sustainability challenges, and energy policies.Proven hands-on experience of indicatively (but not necessarily) of 1 to 3 years in:any energy field (e.g. trading, renewable energies, retail markets, networks etc.)any business practice (e.g. transactions, management consulting, engineering etc.)Additionally, we highly value:computer programming (e.g. Matlab, Visual Basic, VBA etc.)database skills (e.g. MS Access or MS SQL Server)knowledge of Portuguese, French or another European languagetechnology expertise in batteries, renewable gases, financial modelsWe value a healthy work life balance and diversity. We can consider a range of flexible working arrangements. Please include your preferences in your application.In AFRY Management Consulting we offer a competitive salary, a performance related bonus scheme and an excellent range of benefits.As part of your online application process, please provide a CV and covering letter stating why you want to work for AFRY and your salary expectations. We only accept online applications.If we think you could be a good fit for the organization you will be invited for a telephone interview following which, if we are both happy to continue the process, you will then be invited to a face-to-face interview.
